images.location: Site – existing church and proposed changes
images.text_verbatim:
Site Plan
1" = 20'-0"
EXISTING CHURCH PROPOSED TO CHANGE TO RESIDENTIAL USE APPROX. 1822 SF 169.2 sq.m
PROPOSED LOCATION OF SEWAGE TANK
NEW 2 CAR REQUIRED PARKING AS PER BYLAW
30m SETBACK FROM LEACHING PIPES TO NEIGHBOUR'S WELL
15' - 0" 4.57 m
15' SETBACK FROM NEAREST GRAVE AS PER BAO GUIDELINES
100' - 0" 30.48 m
APPROX. WEEPING BED SIZE BASED OFF SOIL TYPE. REFER TO SEPTIC SYSTEM APPLICATION FOR DETAILS.
TREES (TYP.)
7516 WELLINGTON RD 8, ALMA
images.summary: This site plan illustrates the layout of the existing church and proposed changes, including the location of a new sewage tank and a parking area. The plan shows setback distances from various site features, such as a 30m setback from leaching pipes to the neighbor's well and a 15' setback from the nearest grave as per BAO guidelines. The existing church is proposed to change to residential use, approximately 1822 SF (169.2 sq.m). The plan is drawn at a scale of 1" = 20'-0" and includes notes on compliance with local guidelines.

images.summary: The basement floor plan details the layout of the basement, including the mechanical room (179.22 SF), master bedroom (135.00 SF), and sewage tank location. It highlights weight-bearing walls and provides notes on existing and proposed structural elements. The plan is drawn at a scale of 1/8" = 1'-0". Section callouts '1/A3.02' and '1/A3.01' indicate connections to other views. The plan includes compliance notes for existing single exits and new parking requirements.

images.summary: The main floor plan shows the layout of the ground floor, including the kitchen, dining, and living areas (900.31 SF), as well as bedrooms. It identifies load-bearing walls and notes on the structural integrity of existing walls. The plan is drawn at a scale of 3/16" = 1'-0". Section callouts '1/A3.02' and '1/A3.01' provide connections to other views. Notes indicate that all walls are to be 2x4 unless otherwise noted, and exterior windows are to be replaced as needed.

images.summary: The second floor plan outlines the layout of the upper floor, featuring a rec room (119.48 SF) and bedroom 3 (156.22 SF), along with a decor platform. It provides dimensions and notes on structural elements. The plan is drawn at a scale of 3/16" = 1'-0". Section callouts '1/A3.02' and '1/A3.01' indicate connections to other views. A note specifies that new windows must conform to egress standards.

images.text_verbatim:
Section 1
3/16" = 1'-0"
EXISTING ROOF IN STRUCTURALLY SOUND CONDITION
STEEL SHEET ROOFING
WOOD SHINGLES
2x4 WOOD VESTIBULE SCISSOR TRUSSES
INSTALL NEW BLOWN-IN INSULATION MIN. R75
EXISTING WALLS IN STRUCTURALLY SOUND CONDITION
EXISTING 24" THICK LATERALLY UNSUPPORTED RUBBLE FOUNDATION IN GOOD CONDITION
images.summary: This section sheet provides longitudinal sections of the building, detailing roof trusses, insulation, and wall sections. The existing roof is in structurally sound condition with steel sheet roofing and wood shingles. The section highlights the installation of new blown-in insulation with a minimum R-value of 75. Existing walls are noted to be in structurally sound condition, and the existing 24" thick laterally unsupported rubble foundation is in good condition. The sections are drawn at a scale of 3/16" = 1'-0". Section callout '1/A3.01' references this view.

images.summary: This section view provides a detailed transverse cut through the building, highlighting multiple levels including the attic, main floor, and basement. The attic is specified to have R75 blown-in insulation. The main floor features a kitchen/dining/living area of 960.31 square feet and a rec room of 1194.88 square feet. Bedroom 1 is 120.75 square feet. New floor construction includes 5/8" tongue and groove floor plywood, glued and screwed, with 2x8 floor joists spaced at 16 inches on center, complete with blocking at midspan. A 2x10 rim board is fastened to existing 16-inch brick using 1/2-inch diameter turn-in concrete lags, embedded a minimum of 6 inches and staggered at 24 inches on center. Existing 2x12 wood floor joists are spaced at 16 inches on center. The section also details a new 4-inch drainage tile around the perimeter of the existing building, draining into a new sump pit. The section callout '1/A3.01' indicates a reference to another drawing. Dimensions such as 21'-8 1/2", 15'-12", and 10'-6 1/2" are provided for various elements. The section is oriented looking east and includes compliance with building codes, such as railing specifications per OBC (Ontario Building Code).

images.summary: This section view provides a detailed transverse cut through the building, highlighting multiple levels including the attic, main floor, and basement. The attic is specified to have R75 blown-in insulation. The main floor features a kitchen/dining/living area of 900.31 square feet and a rec room of 1194.88 square feet. Bedroom 1 is 120.75 square feet. New floor construction includes 5/8" tongue and groove floor plywood, glued and screwed, with 2x8 floor joists spaced at 16 inches on center, complete with blocking at midspan. A 2x10 rim board is fastened to existing 16-inch brick using 1/2-inch diameter turn-in concrete lags, embedded a minimum of 6 inches and staggered at 24 inches on center. Existing 2x12 wood floor joists are spaced at 16 inches on center. The section also details a new 4-inch drainage tile around the perimeter of the existing building, draining into a new sump pit. The section callout '1/A3.01' indicates a reference to another drawing. Dimensions such as 21'-8 1/2", 5 1/2", and 10'-6 1/2" are provided for various elements. The section is oriented looking east and includes compliance with building codes, such as railing specifications per OBC (Ontario Building Code). Additional spaces include a foyer of 150.27 square feet, a kitchen/dining/living area of 692.03 square feet, a master bedroom of 135.00 square feet, and an existing mechanical room of 179.22 square feet.
